text: the bombing was a shock to a lot of us
because boston is such
it's it's kind of a small town in a way
because it's you know
there are universities here and there's
a huge event as a marathon and everyone
was part of the marathon
and so when it happened it really really
shook me
i was thinking a lot in my head but not
feeling much in my heart
so i found myself
an excuse the next morning when i went
into
a store and bought a white board
so i just started kind of asking people
would you like to leave a message for
boston on a whiteboard now photograph
you i'll put online and let's see what
happens
it was such a privilege for me
to be able to walk into
the lives of so many people i would
probably just walk by
had this event all happened
and be able to share in that moment of
poignancy
hold that sadness
hold that sense of hope and love
and be able to share that with the rest
of the world
and so just by walking around town and
holding a whiteboard and taking
photographs i realized i've actually
made a difference quite immediately
